alert.note: Alert for Irion (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 9:27AM CDT until May 30 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Irion and Tom Green. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 922 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms...from south of Mertzon to just east of San Angelo to Wall and Veribest. Movement was quickly southeast at 35 mph. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. 0.55 inches has fallen at the weather service office in San Angelo at 925 AM. While the heaviest rain has passed east of San Angelo, it will take an hour for flooded streets and low water crossings to drain. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Angelo, Mertzon, Christoval, Twin Buttes Reservoir, Tankersley, Lake Nasworthy, Knickerbocker, San Angelo State Park, O.c. Fisher Reservoir, Arden, Goodfellow Air Force Base, Grape Creek, Sherwood, Carlsbad, Wall, Water Valley, Veribest, Orient, Vancourt and Mereta. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... College Hills and Millbrook, Southwest Blvd and Loop 306, Howard and Webster, Jackson From Knickerbocker to South Bryant, FM 1692 crossing Concho River, FM 2334 crossing Ninemile Creek, RM 853 crossing Dry Draw, FM 1692 crossing The Draw, Ranch Road 859 crossing west Rocky Creek and FM 1692 crossing Sales Branch. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
